title: Jarred Ezra Randall
text:
I am a Miami-born, Philadelphia-based professional with a recent Master’s degree in Urban Spatial Analytics (MUSA) with a concentration in Affordable Housing & Policy from the University of Pennsylvania. I also hold a Bachelor’s degree in Landscape Architecture from the University of Florida and have diverse professional experience as a Landscape Designer II, Project Manager & Geospatial Analyst, Specimen Technician, and Chef. My unique background enables me to excel in collaborative, deadline-driven environments while effectively managing teams during high-pressure periods.
My passion lies in using data-driven design as a tool for social justice, particularly in promoting equitable urban green spaces and implementing green infrastructure. I am committed to leveraging spatial analysis, GIS, and data visualization to support community-driven design practices. I possess a robust skill set, including proficiency in advanced data analysis, statistical modeling, and programming in R and Python. Throughout my career, I have consistently demonstrated the ability to manage projects effectively, deliver insightful analyses, and excel in team-oriented environments with a focus on clear communication, time management, and a strong work ethic.



Led diverse landscape design and analytical projects: Demonstrated strong project management and analytical skills, ensuring timely and successful project completion with data-driven insights.
Conducted in-depth proposal research: Resulted in a higher project win rate and improved decision-making by providing detailed and compelling data analyses and project proposals.
Created innovative conceptual designs and analytical models: Met client specifications and exceeded expectations through creativity, attention to detail, and the application of rigorous statistical models for predictive analysis and scenario planning.
Developed comprehensive construction documents and data frameworks: Ensured accurate plans for implementation and established robust frameworks for spatial data analysis and statistical evaluation, enhancing project accuracy and reliability.
Coordinated with regulatory agencies: Ensured project compliance and smooth approval processes by liaising effectively with relevant authorities.
Produced high-quality graphic exhibits, renderings, and data visualizations: Communicated design concepts and analytical insights effectively to clients and stakeholders, using data visualization tools to translate complex statistical data into actionable insights.
Conducted survey fieldwork and data collection: Gathered essential data for project planning and spatial analysis, contributing to informed and accurate design decisions.





Project Management & Leadership: Effective in leading projects from conception to completion with a focus on data-driven decision-making.
Creative Thinking and Problem Solving:: Adept at generating innovative solutions and tackling complex challenges in both design and analysis.
Research and Data Analysis: Proficient in conducting thorough research and applying advanced statistical techniques for data-driven insights.
Advanced Data Analysis, Visualization, and Management: Skilled in utilizing advanced techniques for data analysis, spatial modeling, and visualization using R, Python, and GIS.
Data-Driven Design and Analysis: Expertise in applying spatial analysis and statistical modeling to inform design and operational decisions.
Collaboration: Thrive in collaborative work environments, working effectively with teams, stakeholders, and clients.




In my free time, I’m a musician and still an avid cook who loves to cook over an open fire. I have played in musical projects based in Gainesville, FL & Jamaica Plain, MA, including Kvetch, Tiny Farm, and Camp Hope. I enjoy going on hikes with my dog Ripley and am a big sports fan, especially of Miami teams like the Heat, Panthers, and Dolphins.



Meet Ripley!

title: Resume
text: It appears you don’t have a PDF plugin for this browser. No biggie… you can click here to download the PDF file.

title: A Planning Support Tool for Affordable and Workforce Housing Site Identification
text:
For an independent study in applications of remote sensing for sustainable urban planning, I used Google Earth Engine and global wetlands datasets to train a Random Forest model on Landsat 7 spectral images and assess wetlands change from 2000 to 2020.
My model achieved 95% accuracy and 65% recall, and suggests that the Iberá wetlands have declined significantly in the past 20 years.
library(htmltools)
includeHTML("Projects/Practicum/Watauga-housing.html")
